H1.body:
u10na (probably for van + na from
van = Goth. van, vans: cf. O.H.G. we10n-
ag, few, perhaps etc.), adj., f. na.
1. Lessened, Ya10jn4. 2, 295. 2. Inferior,
Man. 9, 123. 3. Wanting, usually as
former or latter part of a comp., e. g.
alpa-, adj. Wanting, a little, Man. 8,
217. kim5chid-, adj. A little less, Sa10v. 4,
26. tri-bha10ga-, adj. Reduced by a third,
Ra10jat. 5, 170. daçona, i. e. daçan-, adj.
Wanting ten, Ra10m. 1, 46, 12. If one
only is wanting, eka may be added, e. g.
ekonachatva10rim5ça, i. e. eka-u10na-, ord.
The thirty-ninth, MBh. 1, adhy. 39,
but usually it is dropped, e. g. u10na [Page0134-a+ 43]
-vim5ça, ord. The nineteenth, MBh. 3,
adhy. 19. As former part, e. g. u10na-dvi
-va10rshika (i. e. -dvi-varsha + ika), adj.
A child under two years, Man. 5, 68;
u10na-shod2açavarsha (i. e. -shash-daçan
-varsha), adj. Under sixteen years,
Ra10m. 1, 22, 2. -- Cf. probably Lat. un-,
or unde-, e. g. in unde-viginti = u10na
-vim5çati.

u10sha + ra, adj., f. ra, Im-
pregnated with saline particles, MBh.
13, 3341. 2. Salt ground, barren land,
Man. 2, 112.

kr2i + tya, I. ptcple. of the fut.
pass. of kr2i. 1. To be done or per-
formed, Ra10m. 3, 60, 27. 2. Seducible,
bribable, Ra10jat. 5, 247. II. n. 1. Right,
Pan4ch. i. d. 309. 2. Need, with instr.,
e. g. na me ji10vitena kr2ityam, I do not
want (or wish) to live, Mr2ichchh. 154,
3. 3. Duty, Man. 2, 237. 4. Service,
Ça10k. d. 193. gun2a-kr2itye niyojita10, is
used to serve as a string, Kuma10ras.
4, 15. 5. Business, Ra10m. 3, 47, 15. 6.
motive, Ra10m. 6, 33, 18. III. f. ya10. 1.
Causing, Man. 11, 67. 2. Act, Man.
11, 125. 3. Charm, witchery, Man. 9,
290. -- Comp. A-, n. wrong, Pan4ch. i. d.
309; 128, 12. Abhyupeta10rtha-, i. e.
abhi-upa-ita-artha-, adj. one who has
undertaken to perform a business,
Megh. 39. Artha-, n. a useful act,
Ra10m. 4, 38, 43. Asat-, i. e. a-sant- (vb.
1. as), adj. one who has acted wickedly,
Ra10jat. 5, 300. See Ku-. Kr2ita-, I. n. 1.
what has been done and what must be
done. 2. fulfilled intention, MBh. 4,
882. II. adj., f. ya10, satisfied, Ra10m.
1, 1, 84. Gr2iha-, n. domestic affairs,
Ra10jat. 5, 166. Bhu10ti-, n. any ceremony
of a festive character, as marriage, Man.
8, 393. Çi10ghra-, adj., f. ya, what must
be done quickly, Pan4ch. iii. d. 232.

char + itra, n. 1. Ancient
usages, Man. 9, 7. 2. Conduct, Ra10m.
5, 51, 17. -- Comp. Vi-chitra-, adj., f. tra,
behaving in a surprising way, Pan4ch.
iv. d. 57.
